BodyName: Committee on Civil and Human Rights

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting employers from posting job listings without minimum and maximum salary information
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting employers from posting job listings without minimum and maximum salary information.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to open captioning at motion picture theaters
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Open captioning at motion picture theatres.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon on the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor sign A.2619A/ S.7215 in relation to establishing the New York State Community Commission on Reparations Remedies to examine the impacts of the institution of slavery, subsequently racial and economic discrimination against African-Americans, and recommend appropriate remedies.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Establishing the NYS Community Commission on Reparations Remedies to examine the impacts of the institution of slavery, subsequently racial and economic discrimination against African-Americans, and recommend appropriate remedies. (A.2619A/ S.7215)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to Sign S.1083/ H.R. 40 in relation to establishing the Commission to Study and Develop Reparation Proposals for African-Americans to examine financial and other impacts of slavery and continued discrimination and recommend appropriate remedies.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Establishing the Commission to Study and Develop Reparation Proposals for African-Americans to examine financial and other impacts of slavery and continued discrimination and recommend appropriate remedies. (S.1083/ H.R. 40)
